intro: Fabiana heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf fabiana, is a South African plant belonging to the family Stilbaceae. It is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are often pubescent, with a distinctive texture and coloration. Fabiana heterophylla is well adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
